website_summaries.verdict: Compact and easy to pack in small places.
pros: Customers report that the bag fits comfortably around the mouth and appreciated by pregnant women and those who experience chronic nausea
We love that this product is used by hospitals as well
cons: Tabs or twists would be an added bonus

customer_reviews.title: Very Well Made
customer_reviews.text: I drive for Uber, and I keep these in the doors for customer's sake, but, have never had a customer actually use one. They appear to be very well made, I appreciate the solid plastic ring at the top - to keep the opening "open" while in use. I hope to never need them, but, am grateful that they are available.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Burns

customer_reviews.title: If you're gonna spew, spew in this
customer_reviews.text: Holds vomit like a champ, what more can a dude ask for? When your wife throws up 8 times a day due to pregnancy, you become an emesis bag connoisseur. Inclusion of tabs to twist and tuck the opening closed would be nice, though.
customer_reviews.author: A Bettik

customer_reviews.title: Gottta have these!
customer_reviews.text: I got a few of these while in the hospital ,very handy and better than the pink pan as nobody has to look at it or rinse out pan Recently my friend had a health episode and had to use a napkin in the restaurant. I thought these would be handy to keep a few in my purse. Also good for car sickness and any motion sickness . Could even double as a male urine bag when caught in long unexpected traffic delays, as I live in a big city and you never know when unexpected delays happen and your stuck in the middle lane of a freeway going nowhere!!
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: As sad as it is to review puke bags, these are great. Fit nicely and discretely in sweatshirt/jacket pockets, and they’re rather durable, and painless to use...well, except for the puking. Just wish there was a better way to seal the bag, when you can’t get to a trash can right way. The twisting/notches Work if done properly, but I wouldn’t trust it for long.
customer_reviews.author: C.J. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids prone to motion sickness
customer_reviews.text: We keep these in the car for one of our kiddos who would get motion sickness during long car rides. They store really easily and are handy to have around. We have even used them in the house. We’ll keep them on a nightstand if someone has a stomach flu. We traveled for two weeks abroad and packed them easily for use if needed in the rental car or on the train. We haven’t had to actually use one in a long time but I still keep them around because it’s so easy to do and cleaning throw up out of a car or pretty much anywhere is one of my least desirable chores.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Lyft driver!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I use these at work for my nauseated patients and the hospital provides them. However, I can't buy then through the hospital and was thrilled to find them here. My son drives for Lyft and many times his "fares" are a bit intoxicated. rather than have them blow chow all over his back seat, he passes these out. People get a kick out of them and take them as souvenirs.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Bell

customer_reviews.title: I'm a Uber driver and terrified of someone drunk late at night ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Uber driver and terrified of someone drunk late at night puking in my car. I keep these handy in the seat back pockets and side doors. When people notice them and ask what they are I tell them they are elephant condoms. I always get lots of laughs and to date, no one has yet puked in my car, although there have been a couple of close calls. Highly recommend them for Uber drivers
customer_reviews.author: JessicaSchley

customer_reviews.title: Held well
customer_reviews.text: I’m on my second pregnancy and decided to get these since I was so sick with my first. I have them stashed all over the house (kitchen, living room, bedrooms, etc). I had to use one for the first time tonight and it worked really well. THIS IS GROSS: it held 26 ounces, didn’t leak, didn’t spill, and didn’t tear. I’m hoping a 30 count will be enough to get me through this pregnancy, but odds are I’ll be buying more......
customer_reviews.author: MRW

customer_reviews.title: Handy and durable
customer_reviews.text: These are, hands down, a must have if you have children. They are great, little, handy, bags to keep in the car, or with you on the go for the ‘just in case’ accident. These are of thick quality and have a plastic ring on top to keep the bag open when you need it. After the bag has been used, you can just twist it closed on toss it out. Forget about using a bucket or plastic shopping bags for accidents and switch to these!
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: First one immediately leaked. Yuck.
customer_reviews.text: Great design and concept. They use things like this in the hospital, which is why I bought them. My son is chronically ill and we just used our first one. It immediately leaked and he didn't throw up much at all. Just a small amount. Rather than throw all of the others out, we tested the next one with some water and emptied it. It seems like it will hold? I'm hoping the first leaky one was a fluke, but I would caution people to maybe consider a more expensive brand. It is definitely not hospital grade.
customer_reviews.author: Amser

customer_reviews.title: Pregnant and sick? You need these!
customer_reviews.text: Saved me so many times to have one of these within reach. First half of pregnancy(and occasionally still) was real hard on me with the nausea. These bags don't solve it but they make it vastly easier to handle. Keep them in your bed/bedside, purse, bathroom(if you're on the potty already-I keep one right in front of me lol), car!!, literally anywhere keep one, if you never have to use it, great, but if you do you'll be thankful they're there.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Marie

customer_reviews.title: Small enough to fit in your hoodie pocket, big enough to hold whatever comes out!
customer_reviews.text: Small enough to fit in your hoodie pocket, big enough to hold whatever comes out! I used these for several weeks while pregnant and never knowing when I would suddenly feel ill. They fit perfectly inside of a hoodie pocket or pair of sweatpants pockets. They are made of a thick plastic I never worried about it leaking out and they stack well inside different compartments like in the car or bedside drawer.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: The real thing - hospitals use this kind
customer_reviews.text: The bags are what they were presented to be - I mean what can you say about an emisis bag? Fits comfortably over the mouth? Well, I think some sort of draw string at the opening would be convenient for better disposal. Anyway, the product is what it was presented to be and is the same design as is found in hospital rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline Easter

customer_reviews.title: Really handy for car travel
customer_reviews.text: These have been great for car travel. We have a child that gets motion sickness on car trips and having these handy was a great stress reliever. Of course, since we had them our child didn't need them this trip. :) That said, they also double as a handy trash bag for bits/scraps of paper, chip bags, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Davis

customer_reviews.title: It’s essential for every home !
customer_reviews.text: It’s hard to find someone who never through up . I keep it home and in my car . Specially who have kids it’s very helpful to have it . Also elderly or sick person in home. Or people ride in car/plane who has motion sickness .
customer_reviews.author: SOHEL AHMED

customer_reviews.title: Small stacking bags.
customer_reviews.text: A must have for rideshare drivers. They conveniently stack inside of each other for easy access when needed. They hold a large amount as well. If you're lucky, this pack should last a while.
customer_reviews.author: RatingsbyRingo

customer_reviews.title: Standard item in a vehicle's inventory
customer_reviews.text: They are handy to have stashed in all of our vehicles. ..and in my backpack when chaperoning school field trips. Only one, so far, has had a slash in the top of the bag. But it did not render it useless. Closure is easy, just twist the bag and the plastic ring has notches so the bag can be securely shut (think "bread tie" and not "twist tie").
customer_reviews.author: JlS

customer_reviews.title: Car Trips for Motion Sick Child
customer_reviews.text: We love these. I was originally given them in the hospital and we brought extras home and put them in the car. We keep them in the car for my daughter (4yr) who gets car sick. We also recently had the stomach flu work its way through the house and we kept these beside her bed in case she needed them at night. Great quality!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Irvin

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My brother needed these bags as he has to cough up a lot of stuff due to lung cancer and he suffered a stroke. These are better than ones he had in hospital thicker and can’t see thru them. Would recommend to anyone even with kids that might need to use as a vomit bag when I’ll or traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Priceless Life Savers
customer_reviews.text: I keep these in my car, for kids and Uber passengers, as well as use them at home for my mom who has cancer. way better than getting a bowl, honestly who wants to clean that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pukey? Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This bag is the arch enemy of morning sickness as it is always in reach of those about to blow chunks. Stashed them all over the house, cars, bags, and purses.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for Uber and Lyft drivers.
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect if you don't want any of your buddies and/or Lyft/Uber passengers, "spewing" on your ride, incase that they're very ill, had waaaaay too much to drink, or under any controlled substance, these bags will say you from massive and endless cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Herrera

customer_reviews.title: I must have if you drive for a ride share program
customer_reviews.text: These work perfect. I drive for Lyft and Uber and keep them handy just in case. Haven’t had an incident in my car since I started buying them
customer_reviews.author: Andie

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I have a little one that frequently gets car sick. These are perfect to keep in the car with us. They do not take up much space when they are all folded up. They’re quick to grab and open up for use. They twist and lock closed for disposal. I wish we didn’t need to use these, but since we do-they’re great for their intention
customer_reviews.author: Adam Benetka

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for little ones that get car sick
customer_reviews.text: My kids tend to get car sick often. I purchased these to keep in our car. They do their job and we have never had any leaks and they fit perfectly behind seat backs. Definitely recommend if you or a loved one gets and kind of motion sickness
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay V

customer_reviews.title: Pretty basic.
customer_reviews.text: If you have young children and don't have some of these for your car, you should get some. Pretty basic....catches the barf in a less than ideal situation. I gave some to all my friends to put in their cars. Should last a long time as there are many in one pack, and of course we luckily don't need to use them often.
customer_reviews.author: A. Strader

customer_reviews.title: Great for morning sickness!
customer_reviews.text: I have severe morning sickness. I am also a lawyer in court almost every day trying to be professional and not puke in front of everyone. I keep one of these bags in my work bag just in case I need to step out into the hall. I also keep some by my bed because some times, it happens to fast to make it to the bathroom. They are also great for the car. They are sturdy (no leaking) and they feel substantial. The plastic is opaque, so you don’t have to see the vomit.
customer_reviews.author: Loves

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Seem to be well-made haven’t had to use them yet they do take up more space than would prefer in my car
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for motion sickness
customer_reviews.text: These are the BEST thing to have in hand if your kids get motion sickness. I keep them in every seat pocket in our car and bring several on airplanes. They are so easy for kids to use — way better than the crappy paper bags they offer on airplanes! We will never travel without these.
customer_reviews.author: SDSSSM

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Very convenient
customer_reviews.text: My son has a vomiting disorder and pukes frequently. After he messed up the upholstery in my BRAND NEW CAR I had to find something. These work great. They are just like the ones at the hospital. The price is very affordable and now I'm glad I don't have to "borrow" a few when we are in the emergency room next time.
customer_reviews.author: mom2boys

customer_reviews.title: Being sick is bad enough, but putting your face in a toilet ...
customer_reviews.text: These bags are a lifesaver! I keep them in my car for my carsick kids, and at least one in every room of our house. Being sick is bad enough, but putting your face in a toilet makes it even worse! If you must puke, puke in one of these!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Frank

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use,  economical in bulk, and a MUST HAVE
customer_reviews.text: Rideshare drivers need these. Very easy to use and economical for your pockets. A piece of mind knowing your car has some protection in case someone has to puke or barf now. Thought I'd never use any, I was wrong. I leave in my side door pockets so people can access them easily in the event they need'em.
customer_reviews.author: D. RZONCA

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: When you have children that get carsick and you frequently vomit from migraines these are essential. These are of a good quality - just like ones I have gotten from hospitals. I only wish that they came with some sort of twist tie so that they can be closed until you reach a disposal area.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever
customer_reviews.text: I unfortunately became very familiar with these in the ER. I loved them so much because nothing splashes up into your face or hair. Just don't squeeze the bag, hold the ring. It's easy to dispose of and the compact design makes it easy carry with you when you travel.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Pilling

customer_reviews.title: ... to put in to save our car from drunk UBER guests.
customer_reviews.text: bought for my hubby to put in to save our car from drunk UBER guests....has saved us so much money!!! and the best part, the drunks think they are giant condoms! So there's that.
customer_reviews.author: jcaustin

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: I have a three year old with motion sickness and digestive problems and sometimes gets sick on a weekly basis. We wanted bags like the hospital had and these are exactly what we were looking for. These have been life savers for us! The plastic ring makes it easy for her to use on her own if I am driving or if she gets sick in the middle of the night. When she is done I just twist it and put it into the tab. It doesn’t completely seal shut so be careful and put it directly into the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Alixandra L.

customer_reviews.title: work as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these the first time while pregnant, and could keep them in my purse, car, desk. I keep them in the car now for emergencies with the kids. The top is wide enough that they don't miss!
customer_reviews.author: SweetAllieT

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, sorry you need them.
customer_reviews.text: I had a major illness with a reaction to some nasty meds. Pretty sure these drugs were made by the Devil. (I will leave out the details). These bags were a life saver. Good quality and a great price. Worth every penny. I would say I would buy them again, but I hope I don't have to.
customer_reviews.author: George & Eileen

customer_reviews.title: These work perfect for those late night bar runs of Uber riders
customer_reviews.text: These work perfect for those late night bar runs of Uber riders... let me tell ya what, they have saved me and my riders lots of money for cleaning jobs!!
customer_reviews.author: Jacque R

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my, these were a LIFE SAVER during my super complicated, full of puke first trimester! We had these in the car and they helped so much! No leaks or anything. Don’t need to be pregnant to use these, works for people who get road sickness too
customer_reviews.author: Bushra

customer_reviews.title: Saved the day!
customer_reviews.text: This bag saved the day on a trip home. It was easy to get out of the glove box in the car and put to use. Saved a big mess in the car!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kids
customer_reviews.text: These things are great! I bought them for my son who now gets carsick on windy roads. But before I could use it for that, I had to use a few when my kids got sick 10/10 will buy these again when I run out
customer_reviews.author: Frankie

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these for Chemo sickness. They are easy to keep in the glove box, console or purse, not to mention a bedside table. They twist out to a long bag. They are easy to dispose of, they twist and fit into a groove at the top to keep them from leaking. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Kbam

customer_reviews.title: Can prevent a nasty mess!!
customer_reviews.text: I used to be a firefighter/EMT and used these in the ambulance. They can really control even the worst projectile vomiting! Very useful for the home and especially the car if you have anyone who gets carsick.
customer_reviews.author: Bob R

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for pregnancy pukes
customer_reviews.text: I had awful morning/anytime sickness for 6 months of my pregnancy. These bags were awesome – left them in the car, in all my bags, perfect leak-proof lifesavers. Only thing is that I couldn’t figure out how to seal them; I’d just twist the top but the ring prevented tying it in a knot. Maybe I was doing it wrong.
customer_reviews.author: mckeown

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective plus fits anywhere in the car or house
customer_reviews.text: Got sick kids or need an emergency throw up bag for drunk friends? These fit anywhere and everyone knows what to do with them. No defects in a single one so far and there was a pregnant wife, a stomach bug, and two flus to test them with.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Crowther

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: These saved me during my pregnancy. Had awful morning sickness. Much easier to use these then the toilet. They hold up well too, much more doorable then the green hospital ones
customer_reviews.author: Yelnam

customer_reviews.title: Keeping the shopping bags for something else.
customer_reviews.text: The concept alone of having something compact in your car to keep someone from vomiting in your car is priceless. If used in time the worries of cleaning and smelling anyone’s vomit is greatly reduced.
customer_reviews.author: Shepard Davis Jr.

customer_reviews.title: being an Uber driver.
customer_reviews.text: Had one of my customers use one of these, being an Uber driver....can say everything went into the bag...A must have for all Rideshare drivers
customer_reviews.author: paul naujoks

customer_reviews.title: Happily, I've only used them at home
customer_reviews.text: I have Meniere's Disease, which entails frequent, severe vertigo with vomiting. Sometimes it means a lot of vomiting! So, these are comforting to have nearby, in the car, in a bag out and about. Happily, I've only used them at home, but they are exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Handy item to have
customer_reviews.text: Same composition as emesis bags used in hospital emergency rooms. Compact and handy to keep at bedside for sick kids or anyone who can't get to the porcelain bowl in time, and in the car for motion sickness travelers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact. Private. Convenient
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Ordered them for my mom on chemo and my daughter’s pregnancy sickness. The blue prevents you from seeing what you threw up which avoids further stimulation to throw up. Great design Folded to limit space but pulls out to be plenty large enough
customer_reviews.author: kathy Fox

customer_reviews.title: These are really great for the car
customer_reviews.text: These are really great for the car. Keep the mess contained and do a great job. They are the exact same as the ones they give you at doctor's offices.
customer_reviews.author: Peeshka

customer_reviews.title: These bags are wonderful, I carry one in my purse (just in ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband is on kidney dialysis and frequently suffers from nausea. These bags are wonderful, I carry one in my purse (just in case ) when we go anywhere. I also make sure that we have some in the pockets of the car doors. I would highly recommend these to anyone even mothers with little ones that sometimes get sick when we least expect it. They are also easily disposed of. I would think that anyone who suffers from car sickness might find these as a good solution.
customer_reviews.author: santagranny

customer_reviews.title: You won’t be sorry you bought these
customer_reviews.text: I have these tucked in my car door as well as in my house. Best thing ever in case of an emergency
customer_reviews.author: ToDream

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: Happy with purchase and fast shipping. These are awesome to have around the house with little kids, but I also use them for rideshare. They are great!
customer_reviews.author: MissCasciano

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for emergency situations too
customer_reviews.text: When you drive for a rideshare company, these are a MUST...especially if you drive after the bars close. Perfect for emergency situations too! Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Dal22cwbyz

customer_reviews.title: Good for stomach flu type situations
customer_reviews.text: These were very handy as each member of my family went through the stomach flu this week - esp the kids. Even my three year old knew to hold on to it and throw up in the bag. Saved us from having to do a lot of extra cleaning. The bags are sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: AAxis

customer_reviews.title: but after surgery and Chemo they were perfect. I keep a few in my glove box ...
customer_reviews.text: Same type hospitals use. I was not thrilled to have to get these, but after surgery and Chemo they were perfect. I keep a few in my glove box at all times just in case. They are sturdy and do not leak. When you are finished, just twist and throw away. No mess.
customer_reviews.author: Marg

customer_reviews.title: Came in use right way.
customer_reviews.text: Family got sick from food poison. It works as designed and easy to use. Better yet, no mess. Easy to tie up and throw away.
customer_reviews.author: POGO

customer_reviews.title: They are easy to travel with and provide a large enough opening ...
customer_reviews.text: My GF Nan needed these to travel with as she sometimes gets nauseous. They are easy to travel with and provide a large enough opening to not be an issue and you can just throw them away when you are done.
customer_reviews.author: flyerfan

customer_reviews.title: Uber and Lyft driver necessity
customer_reviews.text: A "must have" for every Uber or Lyft driver. I keep a few of these in the pocket on the back of my driver's seat.
customer_reviews.author: Brian K. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: A must have for motion illness or flu
customer_reviews.text: Everyone should carry these in door pockets in car. Easy for all ages in case of upset stomach.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Sims

customer_reviews.title: Saves from getting your car trashed
customer_reviews.text: Great product to have for those Uber/Lyft drives which is what’s a I do, saved my ass with a few people, glad I gave them on hand
customer_reviews.author: Brent Todd

customer_reviews.title: Place in storage for future use. Have several in ...
customer_reviews.text: Place in storage for future use. Have several in each vehicle. I believe this product is a must for traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Steve in LA

customer_reviews.title: if needed..their handy
customer_reviews.text: Still have all the ones it came with (which is great) not looking forward to using these, but when you do Uber, and pick a drunk up, you'll be happy!
customer_reviews.author: Rick M

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Works well for what they are made for. A few has holes though and made a mess
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: the plastic smells bad, which doesn't help when you're already sick.
customer_reviews.author: Candace S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Save your car from car sickness. Very easy to use large bag you will never fill it up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good design
customer_reviews.text: The only drawback is these don't lay flat for storing in seat back pockets (see photo). I keep one handy in the glove box, center console and rear seat back in case of emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Steele

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: Just like in the hospital. I SUFFER from reflux. I KEEP these in my car's glove box and beside my bed. They are the best!
customer_reviews.author: CajunMoon

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely a must for all car sickies!
customer_reviews.text: We keep one in the pocket of each seat in the car as my girls get car sick. We've had to use them a few times and Omgosh, so easy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and store
customer_reviews.text: These bags are Lifesavers! They are easy to use and you can quickly pull them out when you need them. We have a little boy that needs to use them almost daily. They also fit nicely in diaper bags and in the car etc.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Krause

customer_reviews.title: A must have for gastroparesis!
customer_reviews.text: So happy to find these available outside a hospital! Grand daughter has gastroparesis and these are a must!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: these are very handy going through the chemo treatments I need them with me.
customer_reviews.author: Granny H

customer_reviews.title: Bought for a pregnant friend
customer_reviews.text: Works great for morning sickness all day and when away from a toilet to vomit in.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Pregnant Wife Must Have
customer_reviews.text: Great for the morning sickness or car sickness which happens. Great compact. Take anywhere. On plane, and everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Fahim Durrani

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I think these are very good and must have at home
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just like ones in the hospital.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect to bring on trips, especially when I get sea sick.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Mohco

customer_reviews.title: Why not be prepared
customer_reviews.text: Whether it’s for an adult or for a kid we do a lot of road trips in this is an awesome way to always be ready in the event of someone being sick. Worth every penny I feel like you get a good amount for the money .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Good to keep in the car for anyone with motion sickness!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe R.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to hold up to mouth
customer_reviews.text: Great for ride-share drivers! Keep in the pockets in the seats. The hard plastic rim makes it easy to hold up to one's mouth in case of throwing up!
customer_reviews.author: William J. Dabovich

customer_reviews.title: Hard to find barf bags
customer_reviews.text: Very good my second order since my cancer diagnosis. I’m still having issues after my cancer and carry a couple of bags with me.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I love keeping these in my car. They are convient and durable
customer_reviews.author: Kimmybling

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality - Very Handy
customer_reviews.text: These are great to keep in the car for passengers who get car sick!
customer_reviews.author: Healthy Tips

customer_reviews.title: No messy spill over
customer_reviews.text: I keep a few in all my cars. And if using big purse I keep a few
customer_reviews.author: Abbey B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product durable just like the ones in the hospital
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product durable just like the ones in the hospital
customer_reviews.author: Star

customer_reviews.title: good idea
customer_reviews.text: hopefully won't need them, but wanted to stay on top of flu season especially after I had a kid throw up all over the inside of my car once.
customer_reviews.author: Barbie Turkowski

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: I recently had an illness where these were a God sent. Would not hesitate to buy again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but needs bottom
customer_reviews.text: Not as advertised. Water pools in the bottom instead of making the ice cubes.
customer_reviews.author: Jozie

customer_reviews.title: Saves your back seat
customer_reviews.text: These have saved my backseat a bunch of times. Well worth the money if you have kids
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Graves

customer_reviews.title: Carsick
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the car. We have kids that get carsick
customer_reviews.author: Lindy Fabrey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Super handy product
customer_reviews.text: Super handy product. We use these in our clinic and we store them in a lot of small spaces. People are always surprised how large it is spread out. Never had on leak either! Will definitely buy again.

customer_reviews.title: whats to like about a sick bag
customer_reviews.text: what can I say... chemo.... whats to like about a sick bag. But bless you. They helped. He's gone now and I have boxes left. Sigh.

product_meta.title: YGDZ 30 Pack Emesis Bags, Disposable Vomit Bags, Blue Waste Disposal Barf Bags, Aircraft Car Sickness Bag, Nausea Bags for Travel Motion Sickness
feature_bullets: 👍EASY& DURABLE: This barf bag has a big opening rim that fits perfectly in the mouth area to prevent spillage when used, very easy for kids use. Ultra durable, also easy to wrap up and dispose after vomiting without leak

👍SECURE AND SEALED: With its closure system - twist, and secure bag into a notched ring that helps to seal and eliminate odors and reduce contamination. Our blue emesis bags also save your public embarrassment of vomit

👍COST-EFFECTIVE: This 30-pack vomit bag will prevent vomit fluids from spilling all over your clothes, car seat, carpet saving you from paying for cleaning services. YGDZ disposable vomit bag is a must have for taxis and car service providers
👍LIGHT WEIGHT: It is a hand carry one- size bag that has a 1000ml and can be easily tucked anywhere for easy access when urgently needed, take it while car travel or airplane

👍ALTERNATIVE USES: This sealable vomit bag can also be used for motion and air sickness. And this is also very useful in throwing waste products that emit pungent smells like rotting and spoiled food. A necessary sickness bag for pregnant women, kids, elderly parents, anyone who suffers awful vomit
